deterministic-test.short-name: 2 units, indirect contact spread
deterministic-test.description: Test a scenario where the source unit infects the neighbour unit through indirect contact. The infection shouldn't happen until the source unit goes infectious.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 contact each day. The distance of contacts is is fixed at 10 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 2 units, indirect contact spread before clinical signs
deterministic-test.description: Test a scenario where a source unit that does not yet show clinical signs infects the neighbour unit through indirect contact. The infection shouldn't happen until the source unit goes infectious.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness without clinical signs lasts 1 day, infectiousness with clinical signs lasts 1 day, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 contact each day. The distance of contacts is is fixed at 10 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, < distance to nearest
deterministic-test.description:
Test choice of units by distance. Choose a contact distance less than the distance to the nearest susceptible unit.
NB: This test case does not care about secondary spread, so we end the test before that can happen.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 0.5 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, just < 1/2 way from nearest to 2nd nearest
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance just under the halfway point between the nearest and 2nd nearest susceptible units.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 2.95 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, just > 1/2 way from nearest to 2nd nearest
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance just past the halfway point between the nearest and 2nd nearest susceptible units.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 3.05 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, just < 1/2 way from 2nd nearest to farthest
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance just under the halfway point between the 2nd nearest and farthest susceptible units.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 7.45 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, just > 1/2 way from 2nd nearest to farthest
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance just past the halfway point between the 2nd nearest and farthest susceptible units.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 7.55 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, > distance to farthest
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance greater than the distance to the farthest susceptible unit.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 15 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, < distance to nearest, units' locations in projected coordinates
deterministic-test.description:
Test choice of units by distance. Choose a contact distance less than the distance to the nearest susceptible unit.
NB: This test case does not care about secondary spread, so we end the test before that can happen.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 0.5 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, just < 1/2 way from nearest to 2nd nearest, units' locations in projected coordinates
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance just under the halfway point between the nearest and 2nd nearest susceptible units.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 2.95 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, just > 1/2 way from nearest to 2nd nearest, units' locations in projected coordinates
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance just past the halfway point between the nearest and 2nd nearest susceptible units.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 3.05 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, just < 1/2 way from 2nd nearest to farthest, units' locations in projected coordinates
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance just under the halfway point between the 2nd nearest and farthest susceptible units.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 7.45 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, just > 1/2 way from 2nd nearest to farthest, units' locations in projected coordinates
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance just past the halfway point between the 2nd nearest and farthest susceptible units.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 7.55 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 4 units, > distance to farthest, units' locations in projected coordinates
deterministic-test.description: Run again, but choose a contact distance greater than the distance to the farthest susceptible unit.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 15 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 2 units at same location, one infected
deterministic-test.description: Test a scenario with two target units at exactly the same location. One of the target units (unit 1, cattle) should get infected; the other (unit 2, pigs) should not, even though it is at the same location.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
For cattle, the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days. For pigs, the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness without clinical signs lasts 1 day, infectiousness with clinical signs lasts 1 day, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate from cattle units to cattle units is fixed at 1 contact each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km. No parameters are set for movement from cattle units to pig units.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 2 units at same location, other infected
deterministic-test.description: Test a scenario with two target units at exactly the same location. One of the target units (unit 2, pigs) should get infected; the other (unit 1, cattle) should not, even though it is at the same location.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
For cattle, the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days. For pigs, the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness without clinical signs lasts 1 day, infectiousness with clinical signs lasts 1 day, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate from cattle units to pig units is fixed at 1 contact each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km. No parameters are set for movement from cattle units to cattle units.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: 2 units at same location, both infected
deterministic-test.description: Test a scenario with two target units at exactly the same location. Both of the target units (pigs and cattle) should get infected.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
For cattle, the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 2 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days. For pigs, the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness without clinical signs lasts 1 day, infectiousness with clinical signs lasts 1 day, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate from cattle units to pig units is fixed at 1 contact each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km. The parameters for movement from cattle units to cattle units are the same.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: no quarantine
deterministic-test.description: Test a scenario where there is no quarantine, so an infectious unit continues to infect neighbour units after detection.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
For pigs (unit 1), the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness without clinical signs lasts 1 day, infectiousness with clinical signs lasts 6 days, and immunity lasts 2 days. For cattle (unit 0), the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 1 day, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 0 days.
These parameters cause the cattle to be infected, recover, and be re-infected repeatedly.
The contact rate from pig units to cattle units is fixed at 1 contact each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km. No parameters are set for movement from cattle units to pig units.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

deterministic-test.short-name: quarantine, fast detection
deterministic-test.description: Test a scenario where there is quarantine. Quarantine does not affect indirect contact, so an infectious unit should continue to infect neighbour units after detection.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
For pigs (unit 1), the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness without clinical signs lasts 1 day, infectiousness with clinical signs lasts 6 days, and immunity lasts 2 days. For cattle (unit 0), the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 1 day, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 0 days.
These parameters cause the cattle to be infected, recover, and be re-infected repeatedly.
The contact rate from pig units to cattle units is fixed at 1 contact each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km. No parameters are set for movement from cattle units to pig units.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
The probability of detection vs. the number of days a pig unit has been showing clinical signs is fixed at 1. The probability of detection vs. the number of days since a public announcement of an outbreak is also fixed at 1. No parameters are set for detection of cattle units.
The authorities require 5 days to set up a destruction program before beginning. There is no delay between deciding to destroy a unit and carrying it out. The authorities can destroy an unlimited/very large number of units each day.
There is no vaccination.

deterministic-test.short-name: quarantine, slow detection
deterministic-test.description: Test a scenario where there is quarantine. Quarantine does not affect indirect contact, so an infectious unit should continue to infect neighbour units after detection.
deterministic-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
deterministic-test.parameter-description:
For pigs (unit 1), the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness without clinical signs lasts 1 day, infectiousness with clinical signs lasts 6 days, and immunity lasts 2 days. For cattle (unit 0), the latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 1 day, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 0 days.
These parameters cause the cattle to be infected, recover, and be re-infected repeatedly.
The contact rate from pig units to cattle units is fixed at 1 contact each day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km. No parameters are set for movement from cattle units to pig units.
The probability of infection given exposure is 1.
The probability of detection is 0.4 when a pig unit first shows clinical signs. It remains at 0.4 for 1 day, then increases linearly to 0.6 for the next day. The probability of detection vs. the number of days since a public announcement of an outbreak is fixed at 1. No parameters are set for detection of cattle units.
The authorities require 3 days to set up a destruction program before beginning. There is no delay between deciding to destroy a unit and carrying it out. The authorities can destroy an unlimited/very large number of units each day.
There is no vaccination.

variable-test.description: Test that the fixed contact rate parameter produces a deterministic number of contacts each day.
variable-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
variable-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 10 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 contact per day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 0.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

variable-test.description: Test that the fixed contact rate parameter produces a deterministic number of contacts each day.
variable-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
variable-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 10 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 2 contacts per day. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 0.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

variable-test.description: Test that the fixed contact rate parameter produces a deterministic number of contacts each day.
variable-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
variable-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 10 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 0 contacts per day.
The probability of infection given exposure is 0.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

variable-test.description: Test that the fixed contact rate parameter produces a deterministic number of contacts each day.
variable-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
variable-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 12 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 contact every 2 days. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 0.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.

variable-test.description: Test that the fixed contact rate parameter produces a deterministic number of contacts each day.
variable-test.author: Neil Harvey <nharve01@uoguelph.ca>
variable-test.parameter-description:
The latent period lasts 1 day, infectiousness lasts 12 days, clinical signs accompany infectiousness immediately, and immunity lasts 3 days.
The contact rate is fixed at 1 contact every 3 days. The distance of contacts is fixed at 10 km.
The probability of infection given exposure is 0.
There is no detection, vaccination, or destruction.
